title: impl Trait capturing lifetime of type parameter

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-impl-trait
labels.description: Area: impl Trait. Universally / existentially quantified anonymous types with static dispatch.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error hard to understand for new users

labels.name: F-fixed-by-type_alias_impl_trait
labels.description: The issue can be fixed with type_alias_impl_trait

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried this code:

```
fn erase<T>(_: T) -> impl core::fmt::Debug + 'static {}
fn create(v: ()) -> Box<dyn core::fmt::Debug> {
    Box::new(erase(&v))
}
```

I expected it to compile, but there was an error:

```
error[E0515]: cannot return value referencing function parameter `v`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:5
  |
3 |     Box::new(erase(&v))
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^--^^
  |     |              |
  |     |              `v` is borrowed here
  |     returns a value referencing data owned by the current function
```

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.48.0 (7eac88abb 2020-11-16)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 7eac88abb2e57e752f3302f02be5f3ce3d7adfb4
commit-date: 2020-11-16
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.48.0
LLVM version: 11.0
```
```
rustc 1.50.0-nightly (a0d664bae 2020-11-22)       
binary: rustc
commit-hash: a0d664bae6ca79c54cc054aa2403198e105190a2
commit-date: 2020-11-22
host: x86_64-pc-windows-msvc
release: 1.50.0-nightly
```

The issue also affects `-Zpolonius`
